scheme_name: Mukhyamantri Shiksha Alankar Yojana for Students of Economically Weaker Section
sub_categories: Education and training grants, fellowship, stipend
brief_description: Under the scheme, a cash award of ₹50,000 will be given to students studying in government schools affiliated with the Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education, Ajmer, who secure the highest marks in the EWS category in the Class 10th and Class 12th examinations (Arts, Commerce, and Science streams).
detailed_description: The scheme &quot;Mukhyamantri Shiksha Alankar Yojana&quot; was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Rajasthan, for students belonging to the Economically Weaker Section (EWS). Under the scheme, a cash award of ₹50,000 will be given to students studying in government schools affiliated with the Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education, Ajmer, who secure the highest marks in the EWS category in the Class 10th and Class 12th examinations (Arts, Commerce, and Science streams). The cash award will be disbursed through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) into the student&#39;s bank account linked to their Jan Aadhaar.
benefits: A one-time cash award of ₹50,000/- per student. A Certificate of Appreciation.
A total of 32 students will be benefitted under the scheme.
10 boys and 10 girls (total 20 students) will be selected.

In Arts stream: 2 boys and 2 girls (total 4 students) will be selected. In Science stream: 2 boys and 2 girls (total 4 students) will be selected. In Commerce stream: 2 boys and 2 girls (total 4 students) will be selected.
The amount receive through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to the bank account linked to the student's JanAadhaar.
eligibility_criteria:
The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan. The student should belong to the Economically Weaker Section (EWS). The student is studying in government schools in Rajasthan. The applicant should be enrolled in the 10 th or 12th class. The student should have secured the highest marks in the 10 th and 12 th class board examinations conducted by the Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education, Ajmer (for Arts, Commerce, and Science streams).
Note: Students benefiting from any other incentive schemes run by the state and central government will also be eligible for benefits under the scheme.

steps: Step 1: To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the applicant needs to contact their respective school or college administration. Step 2: Submit copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required) to the school/college.
The complete application process is managed by the school principal through the Shaladarpan Beneficiary module.

Visit the Shaladarpan official portal and click on " School/Office Login "   Log in to the Beneficiary Portal to apply and click on "OTHER SCHEMES" to view the class-wise data for EWS and OBC category students. The list of students for whom data is filled will be displayed. Click on the "APPLY" button next to the eligible student's name to fill the application. The student's application will open, and the following details need to be filled:

Student's address. Student's family's Janadhar ID number and Janadhar ID of the student's family head. Student's mobile number, parent's mobile number, and family's annual income. Previous year's exam details and obtained marks (for classes 6, 7, 8, and 10). Previous year's marks in Science, English, and Mathematics (for classes 6, 7, 8, and 10). For students studying in classes 6 to 9, only the previous year's board exam marks and details of the previous class need to be filled. Selection of students from the merit list will be in groups of up to 10. For orphaned students, related information needs to be marked as "Yes".
7. Bank account information needs to be provided in the given option.
8. All filled details should be carefully checked before clicking "APPLY" to lock the application.
9. The school principal will send the proposal with the help of the OTP received on their mobile number.
10. Applications not locked by the last date will be automatically locked.
11. Ineligible students can be rejected by clicking the "REJECT" button and providing the reason for rejection.
Designation: Director, Secondary Education Rajasthan, Bikaner

documents_required:
Aadhaar/Janadhar Card EWS Category Certificate Marksheet Any Other Document if Required
Note: Entry of Aadhaar number in the application and verification of Janadhaar is mandatory.
